intro: Diospyros virginiana subsp. mosieri, commonly known as the sand樱桃 or sand persimmon, is a shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that ripen in the fall. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically appearing in clusters. The subspecies is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and open woodlands.
